title: Blessing is On Forbes' 30 Under 30! - Kinda Funny Games Daily 12.01.21
description:
Go to http://purple.com/GAMES10 and use promo code GAMES10 to get 10% off any order of $200 or more!

Download the DraftKings app NOW and use promo code KINDAFUNNY to play free for millions.

Go to http://liquidiv.com and use code KFGD at checkout to get 25% off!

Forbes' 30 Under 30's Blessing Adeoye Jr. and Fanbyte's Michael Higham talk about Solar Ash reviews, Mercury Steam's next game, what's happening in Final Fantasy 14 and more.

Follow Michael: https://twitter.com/michaelphigham

Time Codes - 
00:00:00 - Start
00:12:26 - Housekeeping
There’s a new Kinda Funny Gamescast up right now featuring me, Tim Gettys, and special guest Sancho West. It’s me giving my review of Solar Ash, us talking about Halo eSports and me and Sancho going on a long tangent about Last of Us Factions. It’s a must listen episode that’s available over on youtube.com/kindafunnygames and podcast services around the globe.
Thank you to our Patreon Producers:
Pranksy & Black Jack
The Roper Report   -
00:13:54 - Solar Ash Review Round up
00:28:10 - Metroid Dread’s Developer is Working on a Dark Fantasy RPG - Jared Moore @ IGN
00:35:00 -  Ad 
00:38:09 - A new US bill could ban the use of console scalper bots - Chris Scullion @ VGC
00:43:50 - Ghostrunner Project_Hel DLC Officially Announced For 2022 Release
00:50:02 - December’s PlayStation Plus games have seemingly been confirmed by Sony - Tom Ivan @ VGC
00:55:19 - Out today
00:58:40 - You‘re Wrong
Tomorrow’s Hosts:Tam and Tim

it is currently sitting at a 75 overall but ign gave it a 7 out of 10 and cam shea had this to say solar ash took me a little over seven hours to beat on normal difficulty and while some of the anomalies and bosses were less entertaining than others and there were moments of frustration with the controls this was a world i enjoyed spending time in this game may take place in a ruinous void but its clean yet vibrant visual design is full of life as is the story that ultimately gives rey's journey meaning tomorrow at vg247 gave it three out of five stars and says solar ash deserves props for its role design the fluidity of movement when you're in the groove and the sense of scale on display so it's somewhat painful to be down on it to the degree that i am it's not far from being a bit special the kind of indie gem that everyone has to play but it's unfortunately just not quite there there's still a great deal of fun to be had here and your mileage with the mechanics might be better but
